title: Oil Prices Rise on Russian Sanctions Risk
summary: In early Asian trade on Thursday, oil prices recovered slightly from 16-week lows, with WTI rising to $62.09 and Brent trading at $65.68. Markets were buoyed by renewed expectations of tougher sanctions on Russian crude, even as caution over higher OPEC+ supply and weak U.S. economic signals capped…

title: Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan Power Up Nuclear Energy Ambitions
summary: Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan are expanding their visions as they move forward with their respective nuclear energy programs. title: Crude Oil Plummets to Lowest Since June
summary: Crude oil benchmarks were trading even lower midday Wednesday, at prices lower than they’ve dipped for several months, even as OPEC+ emphasizes that it is committed to a calibrated increase in crude output, rejecting media speculation of a sweeping jump in inventory. title: EIA Rattles Oil Markets With Reports of Crude Oil, Product Builds
summary: Crude oil inventories in the United States increased by 1.8 million barrels during the week ending September 26, after shrinking by 600,000 barrels in the week prior, according to new data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) released on Wednesday. title: Berkshire Hathaway nears $10bn deal for Occidental’s petrochemical unit
summary: Sale of division would further oil and gas group’s efforts to reduce its $24bn debt pile
